member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Builds a PiwikTracker object, used to track visits, pages and Goal conversions for a specific website, by using the Piwik Tracking API. If the tracker is used within a web page or web controller, the following information are pre-initialised : URL Referrer, current page URL, remote IP, Accept-Language HTTP header and User-Agent HTTP header.
member.param: "http://example.org/piwik/" or "http://piwik.example.org/". If set, will overwrite PiwikTracker.URL
Ignore SSL warning if using https. Danger!
member.exception: apiUrl must not be null or empty

member.name: P:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.PiwikBaseUrl
member.summary: Gets the Piwik base URL, for example http://example.org/piwik/

member.name: P:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.IdSite
member.summary: Gets the piwik site ID. see: http://developer.piwik.org/api-reference/tracking-api idsite (required) — The ID of the website we're tracking a visit/action for.

member.name: P:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds the tracker will spend waiting for a response from Piwik. Defaults to 600 seconds.

member.name: P:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.Proxy
member.summary: Gets or sets the proxy used for web-requests, or null if no proxy is used.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetPageCharset(System.String)
member.summary: By default, Piwik expects utf-8 encoded values, for example for the page URL parameter values, Page Title, etc. It is recommended to only send UTF-8 data to Piwik. If required though, you can also specify another charset using this function.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current URL being tracked

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetUrlReferrer(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the URL referrer used to track Referrers details for new visits.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetGenerationTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the time that generating the document on the server side took.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetAttributionInfo(Piwik.Tracker.AttributionInfo)
member.summary:
Sets the attribution information to the visit, so that subsequent Goal conversions are properly attributed to the right Referrer URL, timestamp, Campaign Name and Keyword.
If you call enableCookies() then these referral attribution values will be set to the 'ref' first party cookie storing referral information.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCustomVariable(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Piwik.Tracker.Scopes)
member.summary: Sets Visit Custom Variable. See http://piwik.org/docs/custom-variables/
member.param: Custom variable scope. Possible values: visit, page, event

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCustomTrackingParameter(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a custom tracking parameter
To track custom dimensions use 'dimension{#}' as the value for , e.g. dimension1.
member.param: The name of the custom tracking parameter. Use dimension{#} for custom dimensions, e.g. dimension1 for dimension 1.
The value of the custom parameter

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCustomDimension(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Sets a custom tracking parameter
To track custom dimensions use 'dimension{#}' as the value for , e.g. dimension1.
member.param: The name of the custom tracking parameter. Use dimension{#} for custom dimensions, e.g. dimension1 for dimension 1.
The value of the custom parameter

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCustomVariable(System.Int32,Piwik.Tracker.Scopes)
member.summary: Returns the currently assigned Custom Variable. If scope is 'visit', it will attempt to read the value set in the first party cookie created by Piwik Tracker ($_COOKIE array).
member.param: Custom Variable integer index to fetch from cookie. Should be a value from 1 to 5
Custom variable scope. Possible values: visit, page, event
member.returns: The requested custom variable

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCustomTrackingParameter(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the currently assigned value for the given custom tracking parameter
member.param: The name of the custom tracking parameter
member.returns: The value of the custom tracking parameter

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetStoredTrackingActions
member.summary: Gets the stored tracking actions, that have been stored for bulkRequest , .

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.ClearCustomVariables
member.summary:
Clears any Custom Variable that may be have been set.
This can be useful when you have enabled bulk requests, and you wish to clear Custom Variables of 'visit' scope.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.ClearCustomTrackingParameters
member.summary: Clears any custom tracking parameters that have been set.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetNewVisitorId
member.summary: Sets the current visitor ID to a random new one.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetBrowserLanguage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Browser language. Used to guess visitor countries when GeoIP is not enabled

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetUserAgent(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the user agent, used to detect OS and browser. If this function is not called, the User Agent will default to the current user agent if there is an active HttpContext

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCountry(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the country of the visitor. If not used, Piwik will try to find the country using either the visitor's IP address or language. Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetRegion(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the region of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the region using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so). Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCity(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the city of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the city using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so).
Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetLatitude(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the latitude of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the visitor's latitude using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so). Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetLongitude(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the longitude of the visitor. If not used, Piwik may try to find the visitor's longitude using the visitor's IP address (if configured to do so). Allowed only for Admin/Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth().

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.EnableBulkTracking
member.summary: Enables the bulk request feature. When used, each tracking action is stored until the doBulkTrack method is called. This method will send all tracking data at once.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.EnableCookies(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enable Cookie Creation - this will cause a first party VisitorId cookie to be set when the VisitorId is set or reset
member.param: (optional) Set first-party cookie domain. Accepted values: example.com, *.example.com (same as .example.com) or subdomain.example.com

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DisableSendImageResponse
member.summary: If image response is disabled Piwik will respond with a HTTP 204 header instead of responding with a gif.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DomainFixup(System.String)
member.summary: Fix-up domain

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCookieName(System.String)
member.summary: Get cookie name with prefix and domain hash

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackPageView(System.String)
member.summary: Tracks a page view
member.param: Page title as it will appear in the Actions > Page titles report
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tracks an event
member.param: The Event's Action (Play, Pause, Duration, Add Playlist, Downloaded, Clicked...)
(optional) The Event's object Name (a particular Movie name, or Song name, or File name...)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackContentImpression(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tracks a content impression
member.param: The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
(optional) The target of the content. For instance the URL of a landing page.
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackContentInteraction(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Tracks a content interaction. Make sure you have tracked a content impression using the same content name and content piece, otherwise it will not count. To do so you should call the method doTrackContentImpression();
member.param: The name of the interaction with the content. For instance a 'click'
The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
(optional) The target the content leading to when an interaction occurs. For instance the URL of a landing page.
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackSiteSearch(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Tracks an internal Site Search query, and optionally tracks the Search Category, and Search results Count. These are used to populate reports in Actions > Site Search.
member.param: (optional) results displayed on the search result page. Used to track "zero result" keywords.
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackGoal(System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Records a Goal conversion
member.param: Id Goal to record a conversion
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackAction(System.String,Piwik.Tracker.ActionType)
member.summary: Tracks a download or outlink
member.param: URL of the download or outlink
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.AddEcommerceItem(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Double,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Adds an item in the Ecommerce order. This should be called before doTrackEcommerceOrder(), or before doTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(). This function can be called for all individual products in the cart (or order). SKU parameter is mandatory. Other parameters are optional (set to false if value not known). Ecommerce items added via this function are automatically cleared when doTrackEcommerceOrder() or getUrlTrackEcommerceOrder() is called.
member.param: Array of product categories (up to 5 categories can be specified for a given product)
Individual product price (supports integer and decimal prices)
Product quantity. If not specified, will default to 1 in the Reports
member.exception: You must specify a SKU for the Ecommerce item - sku

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(System.Double)
member.summary:
Tracks a Cart Update (add item, remove item, update item).
On every Cart update, you must call addEcommerceItem() for each item (product) in the cart, including the items that haven't been updated since the last cart update. Items which were in the previous cart and are not sent in later Cart updates will be deleted from the cart (in the database).
member.param: Cart grandTotal (typically the sum of all items' prices)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoBulkTrack
member.summary: Sends all stored tracking actions at once. Only has an effect if bulk tracking is enabled. To enable bulk tracking, call enableBulkTracking().
member.returns: Response
member.exception: Error: you must call the function DoTrackPageView or DoTrackGoal from this class, before calling this method DoBulkTrack()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoTrackEcommerceOrder(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Tracks an Ecommerce order.
If the Ecommerce order contains items (products), you must call first the addEcommerceItem() for each item in the order. All revenues (grandTotal, subTotal, tax, shipping, discount) will be individually summed and reported in Piwik reports. Only the parameters $orderId and $grandTotal are required.
member.param: Unique Order ID. This will be used to count this order only once in the event the order page is reloaded several times. orderId must be unique for each transaction, even on different days, or the transaction will not be recorded by Piwik.
Grand Total revenue of the transaction (including tax, shipping, etc.)
Sub total amount, typically the sum of items prices for all items in this order (before Tax and Shipping costs are applied)
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DoPing
member.summary:
Sends a ping request.
Ping requests do not track new actions. If they are sent within the standard visit length (see global.ini.php), they will extend the existing visit and the current last action for the visit. If after the standard visit length, ping requests will create a new visit using the last action in the last known visit.
member.returns: HTTP Response from the server or null if using bulk requests.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetEcommerceView(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Double)
member.summary:
Sets the current page view as an item (product) page view, or an Ecommerce Category page view.
This must be called before doTrackPageView() on this product/category page. It will set 3 custom variables of scope "page" with the SKU, Name and Category for this page view. Note: Custom Variables of scope "page" slots 3, 4 and 5 will be used.
On a category page, you may set the parameter $category only and set the other parameters to false.
Tracking Product/Category page views will allow Piwik to report on Product and Categories conversion rates (Conversion rate = Ecommerce orders containing this product or category / Visits to the product or category)
member.param: Category being viewed. On a Product page, this is the product's category. You can also specify an array of up to 5 categories for a given page view.
Specify the price at which the item was displayed

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackEcommerceCartUpdate(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce Cart updates Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackEcommerceOrder(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce Orders Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()
member.exception: You must specifiy an orderId for the Ecommerce order - orderId

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackEcommerce(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns URL used to track Ecommerce orders Calling this function will reinitializes the property ecommerceItems to empty array so items will have to be added again via addEcommerceItem()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackPageView(System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a page view.
member.param: Page view name as it will appear in Piwik reports
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackEvent(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a custom event.
member.param: The Event's Action (Play, Pause, Duration, Add Playlist, Downloaded, Clicked...)
(optional) The Event's object Name (a particular Movie name, or Song name, or File name...)
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview
member.exception: You must specify an Event Category name (Music, Videos, Games...). - category or You must specify an Event action (click, view, add...). - action

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackContentImpression(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a content impression.
member.param: The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
(optional) The target of the content. For instance the URL of a landing page.
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview
member.exception: You must specify a content name - contentName

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackContentInteraction(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a content impression.
member.param: The name of the interaction with the content. For instance a 'click'
The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
(optional) The target the content leading to when an interaction occurs. For instance the URL of a landing page.
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the pageview
member.exception: You must specify a name for the interaction - interaction or You must specify a content name - contentName

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackSiteSearch(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Builds URL to track a site search.

member.summary: Builds URL to track a goal with idGoal and revenue.
member.param: Id Goal to record a conversion
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track the goal conversion

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUrlTrackAction(System.String,Piwik.Tracker.ActionType)
member.summary: Builds URL to track a new action.
member.param: URL of the download or outlink
member.returns: URL to piwik.php with all parameters set to track an action

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetForceVisitDateTime(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary:
Overrides server date and time for the tracking requests. By default Piwik will track requests for the "current datetime" but this function allows you to track visits in the past. All times are in UTC.
Allowed only for Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetForceNewVisit
member.summary:
Forces Piwik to create a new visit for the tracking request.
By default, Piwik will create a new visit if the last request by this user was more than 30 minutes ago. If you call setForceNewVisit() before calling doTrack*, then a new visit will be created for this request.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetIp(System.String)
member.summary:
Overrides IP address
Allowed only for Super User, must be used along with setTokenAuth()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetUserId(System.String)
member.summary: Force the action to be recorded for a specific User. The User ID is a string representing a given user in your system. A User ID can be a username, UUID or an email address, or any number or string that uniquely identifies a user or client.
member.param: Any user ID string (eg. email address, ID, username). Must not be empty or null.
member.exception: User ID cannot be empty or null. - userId

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUserIdHashed(System.String)
member.summary: Hash function used internally by Piwik to hash a User ID into the Visitor ID. Note: matches implementation of Tracker\Request->getUserIdHashed()

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetVisitorId(System.String)
member.summary: Forces the requests to be recorded for the specified Visitor ID. Note: it is recommended to use ->setUserId($userId); instead. Rather than letting Piwik attribute the user with a heuristic based on IP and other user fingeprinting attributes, force the action to be recorded for a particular visitor. If you use both setVisitorId and setUserId, setUserId will take precedence. If not set, the visitor ID will be fetched from the 1st party cookie, or will be set to a random UUID.
member.exception: SetVisitorId() expects a n characters hexadecimal string (containing only the following: "01234567890abcdefABCDEF")

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetVisitorId
member.summary:
If the user initiating the request has the Piwik first party cookie, this function will try and return the ID parsed from this first party cookie.
If you call this function from a server, where the call is triggered by a cron or script not initiated by the actual visitor being tracked, then it will return the random Visitor ID that was assigned to this visit object.
This can be used if you wish to record more visits, actions or goals for this visitor ID later on.
member.returns: 16 hex chars visitor ID string

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetUserId
member.summary: Returns the User ID string, which may have been set via: $v->setUserId('username@example.org');

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.LoadVisitorIdCookie
member.summary: Loads values from the VisitorId Cookie
member.returns: True if cookie exists and is valid, False otherwise

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DeleteCookies
member.summary: Deletes all first party cookies from the client

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetAttributionInfo
member.summary:
Returns the currently assigned Attribution Information stored in a first party cookie.
This function will only work if the user is initiating the current request, and his cookies can be read from an active HttpContext.
member.returns: Referrer information for Goal conversion attribution. Will return null if the cookie could not be found

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetTokenAuth(System.String)
member.summary:
Some Tracking API functionnality requires express authentication, using either the Super User token_auth, or a user with 'admin' access to the website.
The following features require access: - force the visitor IP - force the date and time of the tracking requests rather than track for the current datetime

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetLocalTime(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Sets local visitor time

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetResolution(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets user resolution width and height.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetBrowserHasCookies(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets if the browser supports cookies This is reported in "List of plugins" report in Piwik.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetDebugStringAppend(System.String)
member.summary: Will append a custom string at the end of the Tracking request.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetPlugins(Piwik.Tracker.BrowserPlugins)
member.summary: Sets visitor browser supported plugins

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.DisableCookieSupport
member.summary: By default, PiwikTracker will read first party cookies from the request and write updated cookies in the response (using setrawcookie). This can be disabled by calling this function.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.FixPiwikBaseUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the base URL for the piwik server.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCurrentScriptName
member.summary: If current URL is http://example.org/dir1/dir2/index.php?param1=value1&param2=value2 will return "/dir1/dir2/index.php"

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCurrentScheme
member.summary: If the current URL is http://example.org/dir1/dir2/index.php?param1=value1&param2=value2 will return 'http'.
member.returns: string 'https' or 'http'

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCurrentHost
member.summary: If current URL is http://example.org/dir1/dir2/index.php?param1=value1&param2=value2 will return http://example.org.
member.returns: string 'https' or 'http'

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCurrentQueryString
member.summary: If current URL is http://example.org/dir1/dir2/index.php?param1=value1&param2=value2. will return ?param1=value1&param2=value2.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCurrentUrl
member.summary: Returns the current full URL (scheme, host, path and query string.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetFirstPartyCookies
member.summary: Sets the first party cookies as would the piwik.js All cookies are supported: 'id' and 'ses' and 'ref' and 'cvar' cookies.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.SetCookie(System.String,System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets a first party cookie to the client to improve dual JS-PHP tracking. This replicates the piwik.js tracker algorithms for consistency and better accuracy.

member.name: M:Piwik.Tracker.PiwikTracker.GetCustomVariablesFromCookie
member.summary: Gets the custom variables from cookie.

member.name: E:Piwik.Tracker.PPPiwikClient.SendRecordCompleted
member.summary: 當傳送完成或失敗會發生
